results.text: Blessed are the merciful, for they will be shown mercy.
results.reason: This verse from the Beatitudes highlights the reciprocal nature of mercy; showing mercy ensures we receive it in return.
results.reflection: When we extend mercy, we align ourselves with God's promise of blessedness.

results.text: For judgment is without mercy to one who has shown no mercy. Mercy triumphs over judgment.
results.reason: This verse emphasizes the importance of mercy in overcoming judgment, suggesting that mercy leads to a more compassionate outcome.
results.reflection: Our merciful actions can overshadow the harshness of judgment, fostering a forgiving spirit.

results.text: He has shown you, O mortal, what is good. And what does the Lord require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.
results.reason: Here, mercy is presented as a fundamental requirement from God, highlighting its importance in our spiritual walk.
results.reflection: Mercy is not just a choice but a divine expectation for a righteous life.

results.text: But because of his great love for us, God, who is rich in mercy, made us alive with Christ even when we were dead in transgressionsâ€”it is by grace you have been saved.
results.reason: God's rich mercy in granting us life through Christ serves as the ultimate example for us to emulate in our interactions.
results.reflection: As recipients of God's mercy, we are called to mirror His compassion and grace to others.

results.text: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.
results.reason: This commandment from Jesus instructs us to emulate the perfect mercy of God, reinforcing our spiritual duty to show mercy.
results.reflection: In showing mercy, we reflect the divine character of our Heavenly Father.
